document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the Neotropical pirate spiders of the genus Gelanor Thorell, 1869 (Araneae, Mimetidae) with the description of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the Neotropical pirate spiders of the genus Gelanor Thorell, 1869 (Araneae, Mimetidae) with the description of five new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Galena zonata
C. L. Koch, 1845
: 105
, fig. 1032

Gelanor zonatus
Mello-Leitão, 1929 b
: 560
, plate. 4 , figs. 22, 25, plate 6 , figs. 34–35 (mf).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gelanor distinctus O. P.-
Cambridge, 1899
. Female holotype from Panama , Bugaba (Champion). No other collection data (Not examined). We were unable to locate the type specimen, however the description and female genitalia illustrations allow the species identification. In addition,
Chickering ( 1947 )
designated a female hypotype ( 2 ) that we are including here (
Fig. 50
), because the specimen matches Cambridge’s description and drawings. Hypotype from: Panamá , Canal Zone, Barro Colorado Island. Biological Zone.
August 1939
( MCZ , examined). New synonymy . 1

Gelanor insularis
Mello-Leitão, 1929
. Male holotype (
Fig. 51
) from Brazil , São Paulo, Ilha de São Vicente . No other collection data ( MNHN 18963 , examined). New synonymy.

Gelanor obscurus
Mello-Leitão, 1929
. Female holotype (
Fig. 52
) from Paraguay . No other collection data ( MNHN
122810
, examined). New synonymy.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 49 .
Gelanor zonatus
, male (A–F, LB285; G–K, LB179); A–C, Habitus; D, G, K, Cephalothorax; E–F, left palp and legs; H–J, abdomen. A, Dorsal. B, Lateral. C, Ventral. D, Frontal. E, Prolateral. F, Retrolateral. G, Dorsal. H, Lateral. I, Ventral. J, Abdomen, cuticle. K, Fovea. Scale bars, A–C, 1 mm; D, 500 µm; E–F, 2 mm; G–I; 100 µm; J, 10 µm; K, 30 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks on the type material.
According to
Koch ( 1845 )
the type specimen of
G. zonatus
was deposited at the Berlin Museum but the specimen appears to be lost (J. Dunlop, pers. comm.).
Koch ( 1845 : 106 )
mentioned that the locality of the specimen was uncertain, probably from Egypt (“Ungewiss, wahrscheinlich Egypten ”), but the description and drawings are congruent with the general morphology of a
Gelanor
. Keyserling ( 1892 ) illustrated for the first time the male and female genitalia of
G. zonatus ;
however the drawing of the male palp does not allow a proper comparison with the specimens studied. Since Koch’s type is lost, an adult male (
Fig. 49
A–F) has been designated as neotype and is here described. In his original description,
Koch ( 1845 )
illustrated a dorsal view of a
Gelanor
(as
Galena zonata
), but without the type specimen is not possible to determine what species Koch described (and thus, the neotype designation). In addition, the given “probable” locality ( Egypt ) is clearly an error since
Gelanor
is restricted to the Neotropical region.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 50 .
Gelanor distinctus
, female holotype (junior synonym of
G. zonatus
); A–B, Habitus; C–E, Epigynum . A, Dorsal. B, Ventral. C, Anterior. D, Ventral. E, Posterior. Scale bars, A–B, 1 mm; C–E, 200 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Neotype designation
. Argentina , (Provincia de Corrientes, San Cayetano, Estación Biológica de Corrientes (EBCo).
5–10 .xi. 2007
. 50 m.
S 27 ° 32 ' 44.8 "
,
W 58 ° 40 ' 52.8 "
. C. Grismado, L. Piacentini, M. Izquierdo, L. Compagnucci, J. Martínez leg.; male,
neotype
( MACN ).

Synonymy . Examination of the type material as well as illustrations on the descriptions (in those cases where we did not have access to the type ), was sufficient to justify the synonymies proposed for this species, based on the unique characteristic carapace and sternum color pattern, as well as the cymbial flap with small indentations (see Diagnosis).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 52 .
Gelanor obscurus
, female holotype (junior synonym of G. z o n a t u s ); A–B, Habitus; C, Cephalothorax; D–F, Epigynum . A, Dorsal. B, Ventral. C, Frontal. D, Anterior. E, Ventral. F, Posterior. Scale bars, A–B, 2 mm; C, 1 mm. D–F, 200 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Carapace with a distinctive color pattern (in live and fresh specimens) consisting of a dark triangular shape that runs from carapace apex to ocular region; a second triangular shape runs from fovea to posterior carapace margin, one transversal dark line in ocular area, one on cephalic area, and four marks, two on each side of the carapace (
Figs. 49
A, 50 A, 52 A, 55 A, F). Sternum with a dark transversal stripe at coxae II height and four dark marks posterior to it (Fig. 55 F).

Description .
Male neotype
from: ARGENTINA : Provincia de Corrientes, San Cayetano, Estación Biológica de Corrientes (EBCo). - 27.034667 ; - 58.000778 .
5–10 .xi. 2007
. 50 m. C. Grismado, L. Piacentini, M. Izquierdo, L. Compagnucci, J. Martínez Leg. (LB 285 M). Habitus as in
Figs. 50
A–D. Total length 3.94 Cephalothorax 2.17 long, 1.66 wide, 0.74 high; abdomen 1.77 long, 1.69 wide, 1.29 high. Sternum 1.11 long, 0.84 wide, pale yellow with a transverse brown line between coxae II, and four more dark brown marks as shown on
Fig. 49
C. Details of carapace and abdomen cuticle shown in
Figs. 49
G–K. Labium 0.43 long, 0.37 wide, with a rounded distal brown edge. Clypeus 0.14 high. AME inter-distance 0.15 , PME 0.09 . PME–AME distance 0.11 ; AME–ALE 0.17 . PME– PLE distance 0.27 . ChL 1.05 ; ChW 1 0.36 ; ChW 2 0.37 . Legs as in
Figs. 49
E, F. For palp and leg measurements, see
Table 11
. Palp as in
Figs. 51
D–I, and 53 . Palp 1.95 times longer than total body length. Cymbium wider than long ( 0.58 long, 0.70 wide). Cymbial flap top edge with indentations and wider apically (
Fig. 53
A, C, H).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 53 .
Gelanor zonatus
, male palp (A–D, LB285; E–I, LB179). A, Prolateral. B, Dorsal. C, Retrolateral. D, Ventral. E, H, apical. F, Ventral. G, Dorsal. I, Retrolateral. Scale bars, A–D; 200 µm; E–H, 100 µm; I, 30 µm.

TABLE 11. Appendage measurements of
Gelanor zonatus
female

subSubSection.paragraph: Tr Fm Pt Tb Mt Ta

Leg IV 0.31 3.51 0.63 2.3 2.31 0.76 Female. Same collecting data as the male neotype (LB 285 F). Habitus as in Figs. 55 A–G. Total length 7.26 . Cephalothorax 2.77 long, 2.06 wide, 1.5 high; abdomen 4.49 long, 4.94 wide, 2.65 high. Sternum light to dark orange (
Figs. 50
B, 52 B, 55 C, F), 1.44 long, 1.11 wide. Labium 0.43 long, 0.41 wide, with a rounded distal brown edge. Clypeus 0.07 high. AME inter-distance 0.16 ; PME inter-distance 0.08 ; PME–AME distance 0.16 ; AME– ALE distance 0.24 , PME–PLE distance 0.29 . ChL 1.14 ; ChW 1 0.62 ; ChW 2 0.55 . Legs as in
Figs.
56
I, K–M. Detail of leg cuticle shown in Fig. 55 H, and abdomen cuticle as in Fig.
55 L.
For palp and leg measurements see
Table 11
. Genitalia as in
Figs. 56
A–I. Epigynal septum of uniform width along its length (
Figs. 57
A, G) with lateral lobes covering copulatory openings (
Figs. 56
A, G). Spermathecae rounded; less than one diameter apart, not externally fused. (
Figs. 56
B, E).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 54 .
Gelanor zonatus
, male (LB179). A–B, Epiandrous spigots; C–F, Spinnerets, left. C, PMS. D, General view. E, ALS; area in rectangle corresponds to MoPi. F, PLS. Scale bars, A, 100 µm; B–C, E, M, 10 µm; D, 20 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Variation . Carapace and sternum vary from light yellow-orange to dark orange. In both sexes the dark marks on femora I and II can be absent. Male cephalothorax ranges in length from 2.45 to 3.08 and in width from 1.92 to 2.53 ; abdomen width ranges from 1.49 to 1.98 ; total body length from 4.57 to 5.37 (n= 5 ). Female cephalothorax ranges in length from 2.55 to 3.57 ; cephalothorax width ranges from 0.9 to 1.53 ; abdomen width ranges from 2.88 to 5.42 ; total body length ranges from 5.22 to 7.54 (n= 7 ). Number of dorsal macrosetae on male metatarsus I varies from 11 to 16 . Copulatory plugs were observed in several specimens (
Fig. 56
H).
